page.title: 15Wildlife at Pitsford Water
page.content: Pitsford Water is an area rich in wildlife.It was designated as a site of{Special Scientific Interest}in 1970. Over 1000 wintering waterfowl can be observed from November to April.Among the less common species recorded by the{Northampton Bird Club}are Tufted Duck, Pochard, Shoveler, Caspian Tern, Black Throated Diver and Grebes. Various fish live in the reservoir including perch, roach, rudd, gudgeon, bream, tench, dace and chubb.Brown and Rainbow Trout are introduced by the Anglian water Authority for{fishermen. Great Crested Newts and Grass Snakes can be found along the edge of the water. There are badger setts in the nearby oak plantation. The Essex Skipper butterfly lives in a colony on the reserve managed by the{Northants {Trust for Nature Conservation.}
